Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the existence of new E-visas for Nigerians in Canada.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove the existence of the new E-visas.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau signed an executive order for the new E-visas, which is not supported by any official records.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no online record of Trudeau signing any executive order on migration or electronic visas.
Understate: There is no understatement bias present in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by using misleading images and creating a Facebook page to support the false information.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim could be explained as an online hoax or fabrication, similar to previous hoaxes regarding E-visa programs in other countries.
